support_summary: Similar to its role with TDP-43, VCP is directly involved in the disaggregation and clearance of FUS (Fused in Sarcoma) protein aggregates, which are implicated in neurodegenerative diseases.

functions.cellular_process: VCP is involved in maintaining the proteostasis of FUS, an RNA-binding protein also prone to aggregation in neurodegenerative diseases. VCP-mediated turnover of FUS is linked to the endo-lysosomal pathway. By processing ubiquitinated FUS, VCP facilitates its clearance, preventing its toxic cytoplasmic accumulation and mislocalization. VCP mutations disrupt this process, leading to FUS pathology.
functions.effect_description: VCP promotes the turnover and clearance of the aggregation-prone FUS protein, thereby reducing its cellular toxicity. This function is analogous to its role with TDP-43 and is critical for neuronal health.
biological_consequence: Cytoplasmic FUS aggregates or mislocalizes → FUS becomes ubiquitinated, signaling for degradation → VCP recognizes and processes ubiquitinated FUS → VCP facilitates FUS turnover, potentially through an endocytosis-dependent mechanism → Degradation of FUS in lysosomes mitigates its toxic effects.
specific_effects: Mutations in VCP lead to the nuclear-to-cytoplasmic mislocalization of FUS in human motor neurons.
The turnover and toxicity of FUS are regulated by VCP and are dependent on endocytic function.
A direct physical interaction between VCP and FUS has been described.

evidence.paper_title: Cdc48/VCP and Endocytosis Regulate TDP-43 and FUS Toxicity and Turnover
evidence.relevant_quote: Taken together, our data identify a role for Cdc48/VCP and endocytic function in regulating TDP-43 and FUS toxicity and turnover. Furthermore, endocytic dysfunction may be a common defect affecting the cytoplasmic clearance of ALS aggregation-prone proteins and may represent a novel therapeutic target of promise.

evidence.paper_title: TDP-43 and FUS mislocalization in VCP mutant motor neurons is reversed by pharmacological inhibition of the VCP D2 ATPase domain
evidence.relevant_quote: We reveal that TDP-43, FUS and SFPQ exhibit reduced nuclear-to-cytoplasmic ratios in the VCP mutant MNs... Importantly, we find that in VCP mutant MNs the nuclear-to-cytoplasmic mislocalization of both TDP-43 and FUS... are reversible by treatment with a pharmacological inhibitor of the VCP D2 ATPase domain.
